tirupati.name: Tirupati
tirupati.description: Famous pilgrimage city home to the Tirumala Venkateswara Temple, one of the richest temples in the world. Located in the Chittoor district of Andhra Pradesh.

attractions.name: Tirumala Venkateswara Temple
attractions.description: Main temple dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, receives millions of pilgrims annually
attractions.entry_fee: Free for Sarva Darshan, ₹300-₹10,500 for special darshans

attractions.name: Sri Padmavathi Ammavari Temple
attractions.description: Temple dedicated to Goddess Padmavathi, consort of Lord Venkateswara

attractions.name: TTD Gardens
attractions.description: Beautiful botanical gardens maintained by Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams

attractions.name: Silathoranam
attractions.description: Natural rock formation, geological wonder near Tirumala

attractions.name: Akasa Ganga Waterfall
attractions.description: Sacred waterfall on Tirumala hills, believed to have healing properties

tirupati.best_time: October to March (pleasant weather), avoid peak festival seasons for shorter queues

how_to_reach.by_air: Tirupati Airport (Renigunta) - 15 km from city, connected to major cities
how_to_reach.by_train: Tirupati Railway Station - well connected to all major cities
how_to_reach.by_road: NH40 connects to Hyderabad (550 km), Chennai (150 km), Bangalore (250 km)

accommodation.ttd_accommodation: Online booking at ttdsevaonline.com, various categories available
accommodation.private_hotels: Wide range from budget ₹800/night to luxury ₹8000/night
accommodation.dharmashalas: Free accommodation for pilgrims, basic facilities

tirupati.budget: ₹3000-15000 per person for 2 days including accommodation and food
tirupati.local_transport: APSRTC buses, private taxis, auto-rickshaws available

visakhapatnam.name: Visakhapatnam
visakhapatnam.description: Major port city and industrial hub known for its pristine beaches, hills, and naval heritage. The largest city in Andhra Pradesh.

attractions.name: RK Beach (Ramakrishna Beach)
attractions.description: Most popular beach with golden sand, perfect for morning walks and evening relaxation

attractions.name: Kailasagiri Hill Park
attractions.description: Hilltop park with panoramic city views, ropeway, and giant Shiva-Parvathi statue

attractions.name: INS Kurusura Submarine Museum
attractions.description: Decommissioned submarine converted into museum, unique maritime experience

attractions.name: Borra Caves
attractions.description: Million-year-old limestone caves with stalactites and stalagmites, 90 km from city

attractions.name: Araku Valley
attractions.description: Hill station 115 km away, famous for coffee plantations and tribal culture
attractions.train_journey: Scenic train ride through Eastern Ghats, 5-6 hours

attractions.name: Simhachalam Temple
attractions.description: Ancient temple dedicated to Lord Narasimha, architectural marvel

visakhapatnam.best_time: October to March for pleasant weather, April-June for beach activities

how_to_reach.by_air: Visakhapatnam Airport - domestic and limited international flights
how_to_reach.by_train: Visakhapatnam Railway Station - major junction on East Coast Railway
how_to_reach.by_road: NH16 (Golden Quadrilateral) connects to major cities

visakhapatnam.local_transport: City buses, auto-rickshaws, Ola/Uber, rental bikes available

araku_valley.name: Araku Valley
araku_valley.description: Picturesque hill station in Eastern Ghats, 1300m above sea level, known for coffee plantations, waterfalls, and tribal culture.

attractions.name: Coffee Plantations
attractions.description: Organic coffee estates, guided tours available, coffee tasting sessions
attractions.best_time: December to February for coffee harvesting

attractions.name: Tribal Museum
attractions.description: Showcases culture and lifestyle of local tribes - Kondh, Bagata, Gadaba

attractions.name: Borra Caves
attractions.description: Spectacular limestone caves, 80 km from Araku, million years old

attractions.name: Katiki Waterfalls
attractions.description: 70-foot waterfall, 19 km from Borra Caves, trekking required

attractions.name: Padmapuram Gardens
attractions.description: Botanical garden with tree-top huts, toy train, and hanging bridge

attractions.name: Chaparai Waterfalls
attractions.description: Beautiful cascade, 15 km from Araku, ideal for picnics

araku_valley.best_time: October to February (pleasant weather), March-May (coffee season)

how_to_reach.by_road: 115 km from Visakhapatnam via NH16 and state highways

vijayawada.name: Vijayawada
vijayawada.description: Commercial capital of Andhra Pradesh, situated on banks of Krishna River, known for Kanaka Durga Temple and Prakasam Barrage.

attractions.name: Kanaka Durga Temple
attractions.description: Famous Shakti Peetha on Indrakeeladri Hill, dedicated to Goddess Durga
attractions.significance: One of the 18 Shakti Peethas in India
attractions.festival: Navratri celebrations attract millions of devotees
attractions.timings: 4:00 AM to 12:00 PM, 3:00 PM to 9:00 PM

attractions.name: Prakasam Barrage
attractions.description: Major dam across Krishna River, beautiful evening views, connects Vijayawada to Guntur

attractions.name: Undavalli Caves
attractions.description: 4th-7th century rock-cut caves with Buddhist and Hindu sculptures

attractions.name: Gandhi Hill
attractions.description: Hilltop with Gandhi statue and stupa, panoramic city views

attractions.name: Bhavani Island
attractions.description: Largest river island in Andhra Pradesh, water sports and recreation

vijayawada.best_time: November to February (pleasant weather), avoid summer months

how_to_reach.by_air: Vijayawada Airport - 20 km from city, domestic flights
how_to_reach.by_train: Vijayawada Junction - major railway hub, connects all major cities
how_to_reach.by_road: NH65 and NH16 intersection, excellent road connectivity

accommodation.business_hotels: ₹2000-6000/night, near railway station and business district

vijayawada.local_transport: City buses, auto-rickshaws, app-based cabs, rental vehicles

hyderabad.name: Hyderabad
hyderabad.description: Historic capital city known for its rich Mughal heritage, modern IT industry, and world-famous biryani. Joint capital of Telangana and Andhra Pradesh.

attractions.name: Charminar
attractions.description: Iconic 16th-century monument and mosque, symbol of Hyderabad
attractions.built: 1591 by Sultan Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah

attractions.name: Golconda Fort
attractions.description: Magnificent 13th-century fort complex, famous for diamonds and acoustics

attractions.name: Salar Jung Museum
attractions.description: One of India's largest museums with art and artifacts from around the world
attractions.timings: 10:00 AM to 5:00 PM, closed on Fridays

attractions.name: Chowmahalla Palace
attractions.description: Palace of the Nizams, showcasing royal lifestyle and architecture

attractions.name: Ramoji Film City
attractions.description: World's largest film studio complex, Guinness World Record holder
attractions.packages: ₹1150-2500 per person including lunch and guided tour

attractions.name: Hussain Sagar Lake
attractions.description: Heart-shaped lake with Buddha statue, boating and evening entertainment
attractions.buddha_statue: 18-meter tall monolithic statue on Gibraltar Rock

hyderabad.best_time: October to March (pleasant weather), avoid summer heat

how_to_reach.by_air: Rajiv Gandhi International Airport (Shamshabad) - 24 km from city
how_to_reach.by_road: NH44, NH65 connect to all major cities

major_temples.name: Tirumala Venkateswara Temple
major_temples.significance: Richest temple in the world, major Vaishnavite pilgrimage site
major_temples.accommodation: TTD provides various categories, online booking mandatory

major_temples.name: Simhachalam Temple
major_temples.festival: Chandanotsavam (May) - deity covered in sandalwood paste
major_temples.timings: 6:00 AM to 12:00 PM, 6:00 PM to 9:00 PM

major_temples.name: Kanaka Durga Temple
major_temples.significance: One of 18 Shakti Peethas, where Sati's back fell
major_temples.timings: 4:00 AM to 12:00 PM, 3:00 PM to 9:00 PM
major_temples.ropeway: Available for easy access to hilltop temple

major_temples.name: Mallikarjuna Swamy Temple
major_temples.significance: One of 12 Jyotirlingas and 18 Shakti Peethas
major_temples.unique_feature: Only place with both Jyotirlinga and Shakti Peetha

temple_etiquette: Dress modestly - traditional Indian attire preferred
Remove footwear before entering temple premises
Photography restrictions vary by temple - check before clicking
Maintain silence and respect during prayers
Don't touch idols or sacred objects

pilgrimage_circuits.name: Pancharama Kshetras
pilgrimage_circuits.legend: Five temples where pieces of demon Tarakasura's body fell

signature_dishes.name: Chepala Pulusu
signature_dishes.description: Spicy fish curry with tamarind and coconut

signature_dishes.name: Royyala Iguru
signature_dishes.description: Prawn fry with onions and spices

signature_dishes.name: Bamboo Chicken
signature_dishes.description: Chicken cooked inside bamboo with spices

signature_dishes.name: Natu Kodi Pulusu
signature_dishes.description: Country chicken curry with traditional spices

signature_dishes.name: Hyderabadi Biryani
signature_dishes.description: Aromatic rice dish cooked in dum style

signature_dishes.name: Haleem
signature_dishes.description: Slow-cooked stew of meat, lentils, and wheat

vegetarian_specialties.name: Pesarattu
vegetarian_specialties.description: Green gram dosa, healthy breakfast option

vegetarian_specialties.name: Gongura Pachadi
vegetarian_specialties.description: Tangy chutney made from sorrel leaves

vegetarian_specialties.name: Bobbatlu/Puran Poli
vegetarian_specialties.description: Sweet stuffed flatbread with jaggery and lentils

vegetarian_specialties.name: Andhra Meals
vegetarian_specialties.description: Traditional thali with variety of dishes

street_food.name: Punugulu
street_food.description: Deep-fried rice and urad dal balls

street_food.name: Mirchi Bajji
street_food.preparation: Green chilies stuffed with spices and deep-fried

airports.name: Rajiv Gandhi International Airport
airports.connectivity: Direct flights to major global destinations

major_stations.name: Secunderabad Junction
major_stations.significance: Major railway hub of South India

major_stations.name: Visakhapatnam Railway Station
major_stations.significance: Major station on East Coast Railway

special_trains.name: Kirandul-Visakhapatnam Passenger
special_trains.significance: Most scenic train journey in AP

apsrtc.full_form: Andhra Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation

festivals.name: Brahmotsavam
festivals.description: Grand festival at Tirumala temple with processions and cultural programs

festivals.name: Dasara
festivals.description: Grand celebrations at Kanaka Durga Temple

currency.atm_availability: Widely available in cities and towns
currency.card_acceptance: Major hotels, restaurants, and shops accept cards

metro.cards: Metro card, QR code tickets available

taxi_cabs.ola_uber: Available 24/7, surge pricing during peak hours
taxi_cabs.local_taxis: ₹8-12 per km for non-AC, ₹12-15 for AC

auto_rickshaw.availability: Readily available near beaches and markets

apsrtc_buses.booking: Online at apsrtconline.in or at bus stations

booking_tips.advance_booking: Book 15-30 days in advance for better rates
booking_tips.festival_periods: Book 2-3 months ahead during major festivals

general_safety: Keep copies of important documents (passport, ID, tickets)
Use registered taxis and avoid unmarked vehicles
Don't display expensive jewelry or large amounts of cash
Stay in well-lit, populated areas especially at night
Keep emergency contacts saved in your phone
women_travelers: Dress modestly, especially when visiting temples
Use women-only compartments in trains when available
Trust your instincts and remove yourself from uncomfortable situations
Use reputable accommodation with good reviews
temple_visits: Follow dress codes strictly - no shorts, sleeveless tops
Remove footwear before entering temple premises
Don't touch idols or sacred objects
Be respectful during prayers and ceremonies
Photography may be restricted - ask before clicking
Beware of fake priests or touts asking for donations
beach_safety: Swim only in designated areas with lifeguards
Be cautious of strong currents and undertows
Don't swim alone, especially during rough weather
Apply sunscreen regularly and stay hydrated
Keep valuables in hotel safe, not on the beach
food_safety: Eat at busy, popular restaurants with high turnover
Avoid street food if you have a sensitive stomach
Avoid raw salads and unpeeled fruits from street vendors
Carry basic medicines for stomach upset

emergency_procedures: Provide clear location and nature of emergency
Keep calm and follow police instructions
Contact your embassy if you're a foreign tourist

general_behavior: Remove shoes before entering homes and temples
Dress modestly, especially in religious places
Use right hand for eating and giving/receiving items
Don't point feet towards people or religious objects
temple_etiquette: Dress conservatively - cover shoulders and legs
Remove footwear before entering temple premises
Don't wear leather items inside temples
Don't touch idols or sacred objects
Follow the queue system for darshan
Photography restrictions vary - ask before clicking
dining_etiquette: Wash hands before and after meals
Eating with hands is common and acceptable
Don't use left hand for eating
Don't waste food - take only what you can finish
Remove shoes if eating on floor mats
social_interactions: Respect elders and touch their feet as a sign of respect
Don't show soles of feet to others
Public displays of affection are not common
Bargaining is expected in local markets
Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory (10-15%)

language_help.local_guides: English-speaking guides available at major tourist spots

atm_networks.availability: ATMs widely available in cities and towns
atm_networks.charges: ₹20-25 for other bank ATMs after 5 free transactions
atm_networks.daily_limit: ₹10,000-50,000 depending on bank and card type

currency_exchange.best_rates: Banks usually offer better rates than hotels
currency_exchange.locations: Available at airports, major hotels, and city centers

digital_payments.card_acceptance: Widely accepted in hotels, restaurants, and shops
digital_payments.cash_preference: Small vendors and street food prefer cash

mobile_networks.coverage: Good coverage in cities, limited in remote areas
mobile_networks.tourist_sim: Available at airports with ID proof

internet_connectivity.wifi_availability: Free WiFi in hotels, cafes, malls, and airports
internet_connectivity.internet_cafes: Available in cities at ₹20-40 per hour
internet_connectivity.speed: Good speeds in urban areas, slower in rural regions

sustainable_practices: Use public transportation or shared vehicles
Carry reusable water bottles and bags
Dispose of waste properly - use designated bins
Don't litter in natural areas or beaches
Support local communities by buying local products

eco_destinations.name: Kolleru Lake
eco_destinations.conservation: Bird sanctuary with strict environmental protection

responsible_tourism: Don't exploit local communities for photos
Pay fair prices for local services
Learn about local culture and history

transportation: Priority seating in buses and trains
Senior citizen discounts on train tickets (60+ years)
accommodation: Ground floor rooms available on request
attractions: Wheelchair accessible entrances at major sites
Ramps available at most modern temples
Golf carts available at large temple complexes
Rest areas and seating at tourist spots

facilities: Wheelchair accessible toilets in malls and airports
Braille signage at some major attractions
transportation: Reserved seats in trains for disabled passengers

regional_passes.south_india_pass: Covers AP, Telangana, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu

attraction_passes.temple_passes: Special darshan tickets with reduced waiting time

cloak_rooms.availability: Major stations like Secunderabad, Vijayawada, Visakhapatnam

hotels.storage_service: Most hotels store luggage before check-in/after check-out

private_services.luggage_delivery: Services like Porter, Dunzo available in major cities
